 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2">7 </FONT></P>


<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" COLOR="#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">

 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2"><B>Visa Inc. </B></FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT FACE="ARIAL"
SIZE="2"><B>2007 Equity Incentive Compensation Plan </B></FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2"><B>Restricted Stock Unit Award Agreement </B></FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:13%"><FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2">This Restricted Stock Unit Award Agreement (this &#147;Agreement&#148;), dated as of the Grant Date (the &#147;Grant Date&#148;) set forth in the Notice of
Restricted Stock Unit Grant attached as Schedule A hereto (the &#147;Grant Notice&#148;), is made between Visa Inc. (the &#147;Company&#148;) and the Participant set forth in the Grant Notice. The Grant Notice is included in and made part of this
Agreement. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:18px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:8%"><FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2">1. <U>Definitions</U>. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:13%"><FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2">Capitalized
terms used but not defined herein have the meaning set forth in the Visa Inc. 2007 Equity Incentive Compensation Plan (the &#147;Plan&#148;). </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:18px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:8%"><FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2">2.
<U>Grant of the Restricted Stock Units</U>. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:13%"><FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2">Subject to the provisions of this Agreement and the provisions of the Plan, the Company hereby grants to
the Participant, pursuant to the Plan, the number of Restricted Stock Units set forth in the Grant Notice (the &#147;Restricted Stock Units&#148;). </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:18px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:8%"><FONT FACE="ARIAL"
SIZE="2">3. <U>Dividend Equivalents</U>. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:13%"><FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2">Each Restricted Stock Unit shall entitle the Participant to Dividend Equivalents with respect to regular
cash dividends that would otherwise be paid on the Share underlying such Restricted Stock Unit during the period from the Grant Date to the date such Share is delivered in accordance with Section&nbsp;5. Any such Dividend Equivalent shall be paid to
the Participant at (or within thirty (30)&nbsp;days following) the time such related dividends are paid to holders of Shares. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:18px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:8%"><FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2">4. <U>Period of
Restriction; Termination</U>. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:13%"><FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2">The Period of Restriction with respect to the Restricted Stock Units shall be as set forth in the Grant Notice.
Subject to the terms of the Plan and the remaining provisions of this Section&nbsp;4, all Restricted Stock Units for which the Period of Restriction had not lapsed prior to the date of the Participant&#146;s Termination shall be immediately
forfeited. Notwithstanding the foregoing to the contrary: </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:13%"><FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2">(a) <I>Death and Disability</I>. Upon Termination of the Participant due to death or
disability (within the meaning of the Company&#146;s or its Affiliate&#146;s long-term disability plan under which the Participant is covered from time to time (&#147;Disability&#148;)), then the Period of Restriction shall immediately lapse as to
the full number of Restricted Stock Units. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:13%"><FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2">(b) <I>Retirement</I>. Upon Termination of the Participant at or after attainment of normal retirement
eligibility under the generally applicable retirement plan of the Company, a Subsidiary or an Affiliate under which the Participant is covered in his or her home country (&#147;Retirement&#148;), then the Period of Restriction shall immediately
lapse as to the full number of Restricted Stock Units. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:13%"><FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2">(c) <I>Other Terminations</I>. Upon Termination of the Participant due to any reason other
than death, Disability or Retirement, then all Restricted Stock Units for which the Period of Restriction had not lapsed prior to the date of such Termination shall be immediately forfeited. </FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:13%"><FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2">(d) <I>Change of Control.</I> Notwithstanding any contrary provisions of Section&nbsp;4(c) of this Agreement, if a Change of Control occurs, and, at any time
prior to the second (2nd)&nbsp;anniversary of the Change of Control, the Participant incurs a Termination, either by the Company, a Subsidiary or an Affiliate without Cause (as defined below), or by the Participant for Good Reason (as defined
below), then the Period of Restriction shall immediately lapse as to the full number of Restricted Stock Units. For the avoidance of doubt, Section&nbsp;14.1(b) of the Plan shall not apply to the Restricted Stock Units to the extent such provision
conflicts with this Section&nbsp;4(d). </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P>
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2">8 </FONT></P>


<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" COLOR="#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">

 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:8%"><FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2">5. <U>Payment of Restricted Stock Units</U>. </FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:13%"><FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2">As soon as reasonably practicable following the lapse of the applicable portion of the Period of Restriction, but in no event later than 90 days following the date
of such lapse, the Company shall cause to be delivered to the Participant (a)&nbsp;the full number of Shares underlying the Restricted Stock Units as to which such portion of the Period of Restriction has so lapsed, (b)&nbsp;a cash payment
determined by reference to the then-current Fair Market Value of such Shares or (c)&nbsp;a combination of Shares and such cash payment as the Committee, in its sole discretion, shall determine, subject to satisfaction of applicable tax withholding
obligations with respect thereto in accordance with Section&nbsp;6 of this Agreement; <I>provided</I>, <I>however</I>, that if the Participant&#146;s Termination occurs under any circumstances other than death, any such delivery of Shares or cash
payment due to lapse of the Period of Restriction upon such Termination shall be delayed for six months from the date of such Participant&#146;s Retirement if the Participant is a &#147;specified employee&#148; (as such term is defined in
Section&nbsp;409A(a)(2)(B)(i) of the Code). </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:18px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:8%"><FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2">6. <U>Taxes and Withholdings</U>. </FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:13%"><FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2">Upon the expiration of the applicable portion of the Period of Restriction, or as of which the value of any Restricted Stock Units otherwise becomes includible in
the Participant&#146;s gross income for income tax purposes, any taxes of any kind required by law to be withheld with respect to such Restricted Stock Units shall be satisfied by the Company withholding Shares or cash otherwise deliverable or
payable to the Participant pursuant to the Restricted Stock Unit award (<I>provided</I>,<I> however</I>, that the amount of any Shares so withheld shall not exceed the amount necessary to satisfy required Federal, state, local and non-United States
withholding obligations using the minimum statutory withholding rates for Federal, state, local and/or non-U.S. tax purposes, including payroll taxes, that are applicable to supplemental taxable income), pursuant to any procedures, and subject to
any limitations as the Committee may prescribe and subject to applicable law, based on the Fair Market Value of the Shares on the payment date. The Company, a Subsidiary or an Affiliate may, in the discretion of the Committee, provide for
alternative arrangements to satisfy applicable tax withholding requirements in accordance with Article XVI of the Plan </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:13%"><FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2">Regardless of any action the
Company, an Affiliate and/or a Subsidiary takes with respect to any or all tax withholding (including social insurance contribution obligations, if any), the Participant acknowledges that the ultimate liability for all such taxes is and remains the
Participant&#146;s responsibility (or that of the Participant&#146;s beneficiary), and that none of the Company, an Affiliate and/or a Subsidiary: (a)&nbsp;makes any representations or undertakings regarding the treatment of any tax withholding in
connection with any aspect of the Restricted Stock Units, including the grant or vesting thereof, the subsequent sale of Shares and the receipt of any dividends; or (b)&nbsp;commits to structure the terms of the Restricted Stock Units or any aspect
of the Restricted Stock Units to reduce or eliminate the Participant&#146;s (or his or her beneficiary&#146;s) liability for such tax. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:18px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:8%"><FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2">7. <U>No
Rights as a Shareholder Prior to Issuance of Shares</U>. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:13%"><FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2">Neither the Participant nor any other person shall become the beneficial owner of the
Shares underlying the Restricted Stock Units, nor have any rights to dividends or other rights as a shareholder with respect to any such Shares, until and after such Shares, if any, have been actually issued to the Participant and transferred on the
books and records of the Company or its agent in accordance with the terms of the Plan and this Agreement. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:18px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:8%"><FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2">8. <U>No Right to Continued
Employment</U>. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:13%"><FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2">Neither the Restricted Stock Units nor any terms contained in this Agreement shall confer upon the Participant any rights or claims
except in accordance with the express provisions of the Plan and this Agreement, and shall not give the Participant any express or implied right to be retained in the employment or service of the Company or any Subsidiary or Affiliate for any period
or in any particular position or at any particular rate of compensation, nor restrict in any way the right of the Company or any Subsidiary or Affiliate, which right is hereby expressly reserved, to modify or terminate the Participant&#146;s
employment or service at any time for any reason. The Participant acknowledges and agrees that any right to lapse of the Period of Restriction is earned only by continuing as an employee of the Company or a Subsidiary or Affiliate at the will of the
Company or such Subsidiary or Affiliate, or satisfaction of any other applicable terms and conditions contained in the Plan and this Agreement, and not through the act of being hired or being granted the Restricted Stock Units hereunder. </FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P>
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2">9 </FONT></P>


<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" COLOR="#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">

 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:8%"><FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2">9. <U>The Plan</U>. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:13%"><FONT FACE="ARIAL"
SIZE="2">By accepting any benefit under this Agreement, the Participant and any person claiming under or through the Participant shall be conclusively deemed to have indicated his or her acceptance and ratification of, and consent to, all of the
terms and conditions of the Plan and this Agreement and any action taken under the Plan by the Board, the Committee or the Company, in any case in accordance with the terms and conditions of the Plan. In the event of any conflict between the
provisions of the Plan and this Agreement, the provisions of the Plan shall control, and this Agreement shall be deemed to be modified accordingly. This Agreement is subject to all the terms, provisions and conditions of the Plan, which are
incorporated herein by reference, and to such rules, policies and regulations as may from time to time be adopted by the Committee. The Plan and the prospectus describing the Plan can be found on the Company&#146;s HR intranet. A paper copy of the
Plan and the prospectus shall be provided to the Participant upon the Participant&#146;s written request to the Company in California, Attention: Stock Plan Administrator. </FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:18px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:8%"><FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2">10. <U>Certain Defined Terms</U>. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:13%"><FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2">For purposes of this
Agreement, the following terms shall have the meanings set forth below: </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:13%"><FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2">(c) &#147;Cause&#148; means: (i)&nbsp;engaging in (A)&nbsp;willful or gross
misconduct or (B)&nbsp;willful or gross neglect; (ii)&nbsp;repeatedly failing to adhere to the directions of superiors or the Board or the written policies and practices of the Company, a Subsidiary or an Affiliate; (iii)&nbsp;the commission of a
felony or a crime of moral turpitude, dishonesty, breach of trust or unethical business conduct, or any crime involving the Company, a Subsidiary or an Affiliate; (iv)&nbsp;fraud, misappropriation or embezzlement; (v)&nbsp;a material breach of the
Participant&#146;s employment agreement (if any) with the Company, a Subsidiary or an Affiliate; (vi)&nbsp;acts or omissions constituting a material failure to perform substantially and adequately the duties assigned to the Participant;
(vii)&nbsp;any illegal act detrimental to the Company, a Subsidiary or an Affiliate; or (viii)&nbsp;repeated failure to devote substantially all of Participant&#146;s business time and efforts to the Company, a Subsidiary or an Affiliate if required
by the Participant&#146;s employment agreement; <U>provided</U>, <U>however</U>, that, if at any particular time the Participant is subject to an effective employment agreement with the Company, a Subsidiary or an Affiliate, then, in lieu of the
foregoing definition, &#147;Cause&#148; shall at that time have such meaning as may be specified in such employment agreement. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:13%"><FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2">(d) &#147;Good
Reason&#148; means: (i)&nbsp;a material reduction by the Company, a Subsidiary or an Affiliate in the Participant&#146;s rate of annual base salary from that in effect immediately prior to the Change of Control; (ii)&nbsp;a material reduction by the
Corporation or a Subsidiary in the Participant&#146;s annual target bonus opportunity from that in effect immediately prior to the Change of Control; or (iii)&nbsp;the Company, a Subsidiary or an Affiliate requires the Participant to change the
Participant&#146;s principal location of work to a location that is in excess of fifty (50)&nbsp;miles from the location thereof immediately prior to the Change of Control. Notwithstanding the foregoing, a Termination of a Participant for Good
Reason shall not have occurred unless (i)&nbsp;the Participant gives written notice to the Company, a Subsidiary or an Affiliate, as applicable, of Termination within thirty (30)&nbsp;days after the Participant first becomes aware of the occurrence
of the circumstances constituting Good Reason, specifying in reasonable detail the circumstances constituting Good Reason, and the Company, the Subsidiary or the Affiliate, as the case may be, has failed within thirty (30)&nbsp;days after receipt of
such notice to cure the circumstances constituting Good Reason. The foregoing to the contrary notwithstanding, if at any particular time the Participant is subject to an effective employment agreement with the Company, a Subsidiary or an Affiliate,
then, in lieu of the foregoing definition, &#147;Good Reason&#148; shall at that time have such meaning as may be specified in such employment agreement. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:18px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:8%"><FONT FACE="ARIAL"
SIZE="2">11. <U>Compliance with Laws and Regulations</U>. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:13%"><FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2">(a) The Restricted Stock Units and the obligation of the Company to deliver Shares or cash
payments hereunder shall be subject in all respects to (i)&nbsp;all applicable Federal and state laws, rules and regulations; and (ii)&nbsp;any registration, qualification, approvals or other requirements imposed by </FONT>
</P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P>
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2">10 </FONT></P>


<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" COLOR="#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">

 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">
<FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2">any government or regulatory agency or body which the Committee shall, in its discretion, determine to be necessary or applicable. Moreover, the Company shall not
deliver any certificates for Shares to the Participant or any other person pursuant to this Agreement if doing so would be contrary to applicable law. If at any time the Company determines, in its discretion, that the listing, registration or
qualification of Shares upon any national securities exchange or under any state or federal law, or the consent or approval of any governmental regulatory body, is necessary or desirable, the Company shall not be required to deliver any certificates
for Shares to the Participant or any other person pursuant to this Agreement unless and until such listing, registration, qualification, consent or approval has been effected or obtained, or otherwise provided for, free of any conditions not
acceptable to the Company. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:13%"><FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2">(b) It is intended that any Shares received upon expiration of the Period of Restriction shall have been registered
under the Securities Act. If the Participant is an &#147;affiliate&#148; of the Company, as that term is defined in Rule 144 under the Securities Act (&#147;Rule 144&#148;), the Participant may not sell the Shares received except in compliance with
Rule 144. Certificates representing Shares issued to an &#147;affiliate&#148; of the Company may bear a legend setting forth such restrictions on the disposition or transfer of the Shares as the Company deems appropriate to comply with federal and
state securities laws. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:13%"><FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2">(c) If at any time the Shares are not registered under the Securities Act, and/or there is no current prospectus in effect
under the Securities Act with respect to the Shares, the Participant shall execute, prior to the delivery of any Shares to the Participant by the Company pursuant to this Agreement, an agreement (in such form as the Company may specify) in which the
Participant represents and warrants that the Participant is purchasing or acquiring the Shares acquired under this Agreement for the Participant&#146;s own account, for investment only and not with a view to the resale or distribution thereof, and
represents and agrees that any subsequent offer for sale or distribution of any kind of such Shares shall be made only pursuant to either (i)&nbsp;a registration statement on an appropriate form under the Securities Act, which registration statement
has become effective and is current with regard to the Shares being offered or sold; or (ii)&nbsp;a specific exemption from the registration requirements of the Securities Act, but in claiming such exemption the Participant shall, prior to any offer
for sale of such Shares, obtain a prior favorable written opinion, in form and substance satisfactory to the Company, from counsel for or approved by the Company, as to the applicability of such exemption thereto. </FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:18px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:8%"><FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2">12. <U>Notices</U>. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:13%"><FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2">All notices by the Participant or the
Participant&#146;s successors or permitted assigns shall be addressed to the Company in California, Attention: Stock Plan Administrator, or such other address as the Company may from time to time specify. All notices to the Participant shall be
addressed to the Participant at the Participant&#146;s address in the Company&#146;s records. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:18px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:8%"><FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2">13. <U>Other Plans</U>. </FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:13%"><FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2">The Participant acknowledges that any income derived from this Restricted Stock Units award shall not affect the Participant&#146;s participation in, or benefits
under, any other benefit plan or other contract or arrangement maintained by the Company or any Subsidiary or Affiliate. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="font-size:12px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>

<DOCUMENT>
<TYPE>EX-10.36
<SEQUENCE>7
<FILENAME>dex1036.htm
<DESCRIPTION>FORM OF PERFORMANCE AWARD AGREEMENT FOR THE CEO
<TEXT>
<HTML><HEAD>
<TITLE>Form of Performance Award Agreement for the CEO</TITLE>
</HEAD>
 <BODY BGCOLOR="WHITE">

 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="right"><FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2"><B>Exhibit 10.36 </B></FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT FACE="ARIAL"
SIZE="2"><B>VISA INC. 2007 EQUITY INCENTIVE COMPENSATION PLAN CEO </B></FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2"><B>Performance Share Award Agreement </B></FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:8%"><FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2">This PERFORMANCE SHARE AWARD AGREEMENT (this &#147;<U>Agreement</U>&#148;), dated November&nbsp;5, 2008 (the &#147;<U>Grant Date</U>&#148;), is by and between VISA
INC. (the &#147;<U>Company</U>&#148;) and [<FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><FONT FACE="WINGDINGS 2">&#151;</FONT></FONT><FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2"></FONT>] (the &#147;<U>Participant</U>&#148;), pursuant to the Visa Inc. 2007 Equity Incentive
Compensation Plan (the &#147;<U>Plan</U>&#148;). Capitalized terms that are not defined herein shall have the meanings given to such terms in the Plan. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:8%"><FONT FACE="ARIAL"
SIZE="2"><B>WHEREAS</B>, pursuant to the provisions of the Plan, the Committee has authorized the grant to the Participant of Performance Shares in accordance with the terms and conditions of this Agreement; and </FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:8%"><FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2"><B>WHEREAS</B>, the Participant and the Company desire to enter into this Agreement to evidence and confirm the grant of such Performance Shares on the terms and
conditions set forth herein. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:8%"><FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2"><B>NOW</B>,<B> THEREFORE</B>, the Participant and the Company agree as follows: </FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:8%"><FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2">1. <U>Grant of Performance Shares</U>. Pursuant to the provisions of the Plan and this Agreement, the Company on the Grant Date has granted and hereby evidences
the grant to the Participant, subject to the terms and conditions set forth herein and in the Plan, of an Award of [<FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><FONT FACE="WINGDINGS 2">&#151;</FONT></FONT><FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2"></FONT>] Performance
Shares (this &#147;<U>Award</U>&#148;). </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:8%"><FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2">2. <U>Payment of Earned and Vested Performance Shares</U>. Subject to the provisions of this Section&nbsp;2
and Sections 4 and 5 of the Agreement, the Payment Value of each Performance Share covered by this Award which the Committee determines, in writing, to be earned and vested pursuant to Sections 3, 4(b) or 5 shall be paid or delivered to the
Participant on a date as soon as administratively practicable (but no later than 60 days) after the applicable vesting date described in Sections 3(b), 4(b) or 5 on which such Performance Share initially becomes vested. For purposes of this
Agreement, &#147;<U>Payment Value</U>&#148; means the Fair Market Value of a Share on the applicable vesting date. Payments hereunder shall be made in Shares, unless the Committee, in its discretion, determines to make such payments in cash or a
combination of cash and Shares. The foregoing to the contrary notwithstanding, if the Participant&#146;s Termination occurs under any circumstances other than death, any such payment due by reason of such Termination shall be delayed for six months
from the date of such Termination if the Participant is a &#147;specified employee&#148; (as such term is defined in Section&nbsp;409A(a)(2)(B)(i) of the Code). </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:18px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:8%"><FONT
FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2">3. <U>Performance Criteria and Vesting Applicable to Performance Shares</U>. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:13%"><FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2">(a) <U>Performance Criteria</U>. </FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:17%"><FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2">(i) <U>Performance Cycle</U>. The Performance Cycle for this Award shall commence on October&nbsp;1, 2008, and shall end on September&nbsp;30, 2009. </FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:17%"><FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2">(ii) <U>Performance Goal</U>. The Performance Goal for the Performance Cycle is specified levels of the Company&#146;s Adjusted Net Income. For this purpose,
</FONT>
</P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P>
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2">1 </FONT></P>


<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" COLOR="#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">

 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">
<FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2">&#147;<U>Adjusted Net Income</U>&#148; means the Company&#146;s fiscal year 2009 net revenue, less operating expenses, including depreciation and amortization, as
reported in the Company&#146;s Fiscal Year 2009 Financial Statements. Expenses related to covered litigation, restructuring costs, purchase amortization, and other income and expenses are excluded. The amount of Adjusted Net Income shall be adjusted
to exclude the effects of extraordinary items to the extent approved by the Committee in its discretion. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:17%"><FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2">(iii) <U>Percentage of Performance Shares
Earned</U>. The extent to which Performance Shares shall become earned when and to the extent determined by the Committee according to the following schedule: </FONT></P> <P STYLE="font-size:12px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0" WIDTH="84%" BORDER="0" ALIGN="center">

<TR>
<TD WIDTH="34%"></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom" WIDTH="1%"></TD>
<TD WIDTH="32%"></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom" WIDTH="1%"></TD>
<TD WIDTH="32%"></TD></TR>
<TR>
<TD VALIGN="bottom" NOWRAP ALIGN="center" STYLE="border-bottom:1px solid #000000"> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:1px" ALIGN="center"><FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="1"><B>Performance Level</B></FONT></P></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom" ALIGN="center" STYLE="border-bottom:1px solid #000000"> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:1px" ALIGN="center"><FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="1"><B>Adjusted&nbsp;Net&nbsp;Income</B></FONT></P></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom" ALIGN="center" STYLE="border-bottom:1px solid #000000"> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="1"><B>Percentage&nbsp;of</B></FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"
ALIGN="center"><FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="1"><B>Performance</B></FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:1px" ALIGN="center"><FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="1"><B>Shares&nbsp;Earned</B></FONT></P></TD></TR>
<TR BGCOLOR="#cceeff">
<TD VALIGN="top"></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom" ALIGN="center"><FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2">Less than $[<FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><FONT FACE="WINGDINGS 2">&#151;</FONT></FONT><FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2"></FONT>]</FONT></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom" ALIGN="center"><FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2">0%</FONT></TD></TR>
<TR>
<TD VALIGN="top" ALIGN="center"> <P STYLE="margin-left:1.00em; text-indent:-1.00em" ALIGN="center"><FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2">Threshold</FONT></P></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom" ALIGN="center"><FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2">$[<FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><FONT FACE="WINGDINGS 2">&#151;</FONT></FONT><FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2"></FONT>]</FONT></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom" ALIGN="center"><FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2">50%</FONT></TD></TR>
<TR BGCOLOR="#cceeff">
<TD VALIGN="top" ALIGN="center"> <P STYLE="margin-left:1.00em; text-indent:-1.00em" ALIGN="center"><FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2">Target</FONT></P></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom" ALIGN="center"><FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2">$[<FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><FONT FACE="WINGDINGS 2">&#151;</FONT></FONT><FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2"></FONT>]</FONT></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom" ALIGN="center"><FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2">100%</FONT></TD></TR>
<TR>
<TD VALIGN="top" ALIGN="center"> <P STYLE="margin-left:1.00em; text-indent:-1.00em" ALIGN="center"><FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2">Maximum</FONT></P></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom" ALIGN="center"><FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2">$[<FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><FONT FACE="WINGDINGS 2">&#151;</FONT></FONT><FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2"></FONT>] or more</FONT></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom" ALIGN="center"><FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2">200%</FONT></TD></TR>
</TABLE> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2">If the Adjusted Net Income falls between Threshold and Target, or between Target and Maximum, then the percentage of
Performance Shares earned shall be the sum of the Percentage of Performance Shares Earned in the schedule above for the lower such Performance Level plus the product of (i)&nbsp;the difference between the Percentage of Performance Shares Earned in
the schedule above for the greater and lower such Performance Levels, multiplied by (ii)&nbsp;a fraction, the numerator of which is the amount by which the Adjusted Net Income achieved exceeds the Adjusted Net Income in the schedule above for the
lower such Performance Level and the denominator of which is the difference between Adjusted Net Income amounts in the schedule above for the greater and lower such Performance Levels. The percentage of Performance Shares earned shall never exceed
200%. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:17%"><FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2">(iv) <U>Notification</U>. Promptly following the end of the Performance Cycle, the Committee shall notify the Participant in writing of the
number of Performance Shares earned. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:13%"><FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2">(b) <U>Vesting</U>. One-half of the Performance Shares that are earned pursuant to Section&nbsp;3(a) shall
become vested on each of November&nbsp;5, 2010, and November&nbsp;5, 2011. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:18px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:8%"><FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2">4. <U>Termination of Employment</U>. </FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:13%"><FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2">(a) <U>In General</U>. Except as otherwise provided in this Section&nbsp;4 or in Section&nbsp;5 of this Agreement or in the Plan, all Performance Shares subject to
this Award that have not become vested pursuant to Section&nbsp;3(b) prior to the date of the Participant&#146;s Termination shall be immediately forfeited upon such Termination. </FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:13%"><FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2">(b) <U>Death, Disability, without Cause, for Good Reason prior to a Change of Control, and Retirement</U>. Upon Termination of the Participant after the end of
the </FONT>
</P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P>
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2">2 </FONT></P>


<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" COLOR="#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">

 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">
<FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2">Performance Cycle due to death or Disability (as defined below), by the Company without Cause (as defined below) , by the Participant for Good Reason (as defined
below) prior to a Change of Control or at or after attainment of normal retirement eligibility under the generally applicable retirement plan of the Company, a Subsidiary or an Affiliate under which the Participant is covered in his or her home
country (&#147;Retirement&#148;), the Participant shall be fully vested in all of his or her Performance Shares that have been earned pursuant to Section&nbsp;3(a)(iii) but are not yet vested under Section&nbsp;3(b). If Termination of the
Participant occurs due to death or Disability, by the Company without Cause, by the Participant for Good Reason prior to a Change of Control or Retirement, in each case, prior to the end of the Performance Cycle, as of the last day of the
Performance Cycle, all of the Performance Shares (if any) subject to this Award shall be eligible to be earned (based on actual performance through the end of the Performance Cycle), and any such earned Performance Shares shall be fully vested.
</FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:8%"><FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2">5. <U>Change of Control</U>. Notwithstanding Sections 2, 3 or 4 of this Agreement to the contrary, if a Change of Control occurs, and, at any later
time prior to the second (2nd)&nbsp;anniversary of the Change of Control, but after the end of the Performance Cycle, the Participant incurs a Termination, either by the Company, a Subsidiary or an Affiliate without Cause, or by the Participant for
Good Reason, then the Participant shall be fully vested in all of the Performance Shares subject to this Award that have been earned pursuant to Section&nbsp;3(a)(iii) but not yet vested under Section&nbsp;3(b) (<I>provided</I> that, if such Change
of Control occurs prior to the end of the Performance Cycle, the percentage of Performance Shares subject to this Award earned shall be based on the deemed achievement of the Target Performance Level (within the meaning of Section&nbsp;3(a)(iii)),
and such earned Performance Shares shall be fully vested upon any such Termination). For the avoidance of doubt, Section&nbsp;14.1(b) of the Plan shall not apply to the Performance Shares subject to this Agreement to the extent such provision
conflicts with this Section&nbsp;5. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:8%"><FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2">6. <U>Restrictions on Transfer</U>. Performance Shares may not be sold, assigned, hypothecated, pledged or
otherwise transferred or encumbered in any manner except (a)&nbsp;by will or the laws of descent and distribution or (b)&nbsp;as otherwise permitted pursuant to the Plan. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:8%"><FONT
FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2">7. <U>Dividend Equivalents</U>. Each Performance Share subject to this Award shall entitle the Participant to Dividend Equivalents with respect to regular cash dividends that would otherwise be paid on one Share during the
period from the date such Performance Share is earned in accordance with Section&nbsp;3(a) to the date such Performance Share is paid in accordance with Section&nbsp;2 or forfeited in accordance with Section&nbsp;4(a). Any such Dividend Equivalent
shall be paid to the Participant at (or within thirty (30)&nbsp;days following) the time such related dividends are paid to holders of Shares. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:8%"><FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2">8.
<U>No Rights as a Shareholder Prior to Issuance of Shares</U>. Neither the Participant nor any other person shall become the beneficial owner of any Shares underlying the Performance Shares subject to this Award, nor have any rights to dividends or
other rights as a shareholder with respect to any such Shares, until and after such Shares, if any, have been actually issued in satisfaction of the Company&#146;s obligations under this Award, in the time and manner specified in Section&nbsp;2, and
such Shares are transferred on the books and records of the Company or its agent in accordance with the terms of the Plan and this Agreement. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P>
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2">3 </FONT></P>


<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" COLOR="#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">

 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:8%"><FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2">9. <U>Taxes and Withholding</U>. The Company shall have the right to deduct from all amounts otherwise payable to
the Participant in cash in respect of Performance Shares covered by this Award any amount of taxes of any kind required by law to be withheld as may be necessary in the opinion of the Company to satisfy tax withholding required under the laws of any
country, state, province, city or other jurisdiction. In the case of any payments of Performance Shares covered by this Award in the form of Shares, at the Committee&#146;s discretion, the Participant shall be required to either pay to the Company
in cash the amount of any such taxes required to be withheld with respect to such Shares or, in lieu thereof, the Company shall have the right to retain (or the Participant may be offered the opportunity to elect to tender) the number of Shares
whose Fair Market Value equals such amount required to be withheld; <I>provided</I>, <I>however</I>, that the amount of any Shares so retained shall not exceed the amount necessary to satisfy required Federal, state, local and non-United States
withholding obligations using the minimum statutory withholding rates for Federal, state, local and/or non-U.S. tax purposes, including payroll taxes, that are applicable to supplemental taxable income. To the extent any such taxes are required by
law to be withheld with respect to the Performance Shares covered by this Award prior to the date such Performance Shares are paid in accordance with Section&nbsp;2, the Participant shall be required to pay to the Company in cash the amount of such
taxes promptly following written notice thereof by the Company. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:8%"><FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2">10. <U>No Right to Continued Employment</U>. Neither the Performance Shares covered
by this Award nor any terms contained in this Agreement shall confer upon the Participant any rights or claims except in accordance with the express provisions of the Plan and this Agreement, and shall not give the Participant any express or implied
right to be retained in the employment or service of the Company or any Subsidiary or Affiliate for any period or in any particular position or at any particular rate of compensation, nor restrict in any way the right of the Company or any
Subsidiary or Affiliate, which right is hereby expressly reserved, to modify or terminate the Participant&#146;s employment or service at any time for any reason. The Participant acknowledges and agrees that any right to vesting of this Award is
earned only by continuing as an employee of the Company or a Subsidiary or Affiliate at the will of the Company or such Subsidiary or Affiliate, or satisfaction of any other applicable terms and conditions contained in the Plan and this Agreement,
and not through the act of being hired or being granted this Award. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:8%"><FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2">11. <U>The Plan</U>. By accepting any benefit under this Agreement, the
Participant and any person claiming under or through the Participant shall be conclusively deemed to have indicated his or her acceptance and ratification of, and consent to, all of the terms and conditions of the Plan and this Agreement and any
action taken under the Plan by the Board, the Committee or the Company, in any case in accordance with the terms and conditions of the Plan. In the event of any conflict between the provisions of the Plan and this Agreement, the provisions of the
Plan shall control, and this Agreement shall be deemed to be modified accordingly. This Agreement is subject to all the terms, provisions and conditions of the Plan, which are incorporated herein by reference, and to such rules, policies and
regulations as may from time to time be adopted by the Committee. The Plan and the prospectus describing the Plan can be found on the Company&#146;s HR intranet. A paper copy of the Plan and the prospectus shall be provided to the Participant upon
the Participant&#146;s written request to the Company in California, Attention: Stock Plan Administrator. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P>
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2">4 </FONT></P>


<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" COLOR="#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">

 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:8%"><FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2">12. <U>Certain Defined Terms</U>. For purposes of this Agreement, the following terms shall have the meanings set
forth below: </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:13%"><FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2">(a) &#147;<U>Cause</U>&#148; means: (i)&nbsp;engaging in (A)&nbsp;willful or gross misconduct or (B)&nbsp;willful or gross neglect;
(ii)&nbsp;repeatedly failing to adhere to the directions of superiors or the Board or the written policies and practices of the Company, a Subsidiary or an Affiliate; (iii)&nbsp;the commission of a felony or a crime of moral turpitude, dishonesty,
breach of trust or unethical business conduct, or any crime involving the Company, a Subsidiary or an Affiliate; (iv)&nbsp;fraud, misappropriation or embezzlement; (v)&nbsp;a material breach of the Participant&#146;s employment agreement (if any)
with the Company, a Subsidiary or an Affiliate; (vi)&nbsp;acts or omissions constituting a material failure to perform substantially and adequately the duties assigned to the Participant; (vii)&nbsp;any illegal act detrimental to the Company, a
Subsidiary or an Affiliate; or (viii)&nbsp;repeated failure to devote substantially all of Participant&#146;s business time and efforts to the Company, a Subsidiary or an Affiliate if required by the Participant&#146;s employment agreement;
<I>provided</I>, <I>however</I>, that, if at any particular time the Participant is subject to an effective employment agreement with the Company, a Subsidiary or an Affiliate, then, in lieu of the foregoing definition, &#147;Cause&#148; shall at
that time have such meaning as may be specified in such employment agreement. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:13%"><FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2">(b) &#147;<U>Disability</U>&#148; shall have the meaning set forth
for such term in the Company&#146;s or its Affiliate&#146;s long-term disability plan under which the Participant is covered from time to time; <I>provided</I>, <I>however</I>, that, if at any particular time the Participant is subject to an
effective employment agreement with the Company, a Subsidiary or an Affiliate, then, in lieu of the foregoing definition, &#147;Disability&#148; shall at that time have such meaning as may be specified in such employment agreement (or as may be
specified for a term of similar import, such as &#147;Permanent Disability&#148;). </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:13%"><FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2">(c) &#147;<U>Good Reason</U>&#148; means: (i)&nbsp;a material
reduction by the Company, a Subsidiary or an Affiliate in the Participant&#146;s rate of annual base salary from that in effect immediately prior to the Change of Control; (ii)&nbsp;a material reduction by the Company or a Subsidiary in the
Participant&#146;s annual target bonus opportunity from that in effect immediately prior to the Change of Control; or (iii)&nbsp;the Company, a Subsidiary or an Affiliate requires the Participant to change the Participant&#146;s principal location
of work to a location that is in excess of fifty (50)&nbsp;miles from the location thereof immediately prior to the Change of Control. Notwithstanding the foregoing, a Termination of a Participant for Good Reason shall not have occurred unless
(i)&nbsp;the Participant gives written notice to the Company, a Subsidiary or an Affiliate, as applicable, of Termination within thirty (30)&nbsp;days after the Participant first becomes aware of the occurrence of the circumstances constituting Good
Reason, specifying in reasonable detail the circumstances constituting Good Reason, and the Company, the Subsidiary or the Affiliate, as the case may be, has failed within thirty (30)&nbsp;days after receipt of such notice to cure the circumstances
constituting Good Reason. The foregoing to the contrary notwithstanding, if at any particular time the Participant is subject to an effective employment agreement with the Company, a Subsidiary or an Affiliate, then, in lieu of the foregoing
definition, &#147;Good Reason&#148; shall at that time have such meaning as may be specified in such employment agreement. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:18px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:8%"><FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2">13. <U>Compliance with
Laws and Regulations</U>. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:13%"><FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2">(a) The Performance Shares subject to this Award and the obligation of the Company to deliver Shares or cash payments
hereunder shall be subject in all respects to (i)&nbsp;all applicable Federal and state laws, rules and regulations; and (ii)&nbsp;any registration, qualification, approvals or other requirements imposed by any government or regulatory agency or
body which the Committee shall, in its discretion, determine to be necessary or applicable. Moreover, the Company shall not deliver any certificates for Shares to the Participant or any </FONT>
</P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P>
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2">5 </FONT></P>


<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" COLOR="#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">

 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">
<FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2">other person pursuant to this Agreement if doing so would be contrary to applicable law. If at any time the Company determines, in its discretion, that the listing,
registration or qualification of Shares upon any national securities exchange or under any state or federal law, or the consent or approval of any governmental regulatory body, is necessary or desirable, the Company shall not be required to deliver
any certificates for Shares to the Participant or any other person pursuant to this Agreement unless and until such listing, registration, qualification, consent or approval has been effected or obtained, or otherwise provided for, free of any
conditions not acceptable to the Company. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:13%"><FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2">(b) It is intended that any Shares received pursuant to this Agreement shall have been registered under
the Securities Act. If the Participant is an &#147;affiliate&#148; of the Company, as that term is defined in Rule 144 under the Securities Act (&#147;<U>Rule 144</U>&#148;), the Participant may not sell the Shares received except in compliance with
Rule 144. Certificates representing Shares issued to an &#147;affiliate&#148; of the Company may bear a legend setting forth such restrictions on the disposition or transfer of the Shares as the Company deems appropriate to comply with federal and
state securities laws. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:13%"><FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2">(c) If at any time the Shares are not registered under the Securities Act, and/or there is no current prospectus in effect
under the Securities Act with respect to the Shares, the Participant shall execute, prior to the delivery of any Shares to the Participant by the Company pursuant to this Agreement, an agreement (in such form as the Company may specify) in which the
Participant represents and warrants that the Participant is purchasing or acquiring the Shares acquired under this Agreement for the Participant&#146;s own account, for investment only and not with a view to the resale or distribution thereof, and
represents and agrees that any subsequent offer for sale or distribution of any kind of such Shares shall be made only pursuant to either (i)&nbsp;a registration statement on an appropriate form under the Securities Act, which registration statement
has become effective and is current with regard to the Shares being offered or sold; or (ii)&nbsp;a specific exemption from the registration requirements of the Securities Act, but in claiming such exemption the Participant shall, prior to any offer
for sale of such Shares, obtain a prior favorable written opinion, in form and substance satisfactory to the Company, from counsel for or approved by the Company, as to the applicability of such exemption thereto. </FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:8%"><FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2">14. <U>Notices</U>. All notices by the Participant or the Participant&#146;s successors or permitted assigns shall be addressed to the Company in California,
Attention: Stock Plan Administrator, or such other address as the Company may from time to time specify. All notices to the Participant shall be addressed to the Participant at the Participant&#146;s address in the Company&#146;s records.
</FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:8%"><FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2">15. <U>Other Plans</U>. The Participant acknowledges that any income derived from this Award shall not affect the Participant&#146;s participation
in, or benefits under, any other benefit plan or other contract or arrangement maintained by the Company or any Subsidiary or Affiliate. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:8%"><FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2">16.
<U>Acceptance or Rejection of this Award</U>. If you do not want to accept this Award, please complete the on-line form (&#147;Accept or Reject Your Grant&#148;) as promptly as possible, but, in any case,&nbsp;within&nbsp;thirty (30)&nbsp;days after
the Grant Date, to reject this Award. You can access this on-line form through your account at eac.Schwab.com. If you do not reject your award within thirty (30)&nbsp;days after the Grant Date, you will have accepted this award and agreed to the
terms and conditions set forth in this Agreement and the terms and conditions of the Plan. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P>
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2">6 </FONT></P>

</BODY></HTML>
</TEXT>

<SEQUENCE>8
